publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6124 Dave Thompson: Celtic 0 - 2 Ross County, Bucked by the Staggies—That the Parliament congratulates Ross County Football Club on its historic 2-0 Scottish Cup semi-final win over Celtic; welcomes the goodwill felt throughout the Highlands from this momentous win, with more County fans travelling from the Highlands to watch the match at Hampden Park than the entire population of Dingwall; notes that this win puts County on the map as a serious competitor, and wishes these Highland heroes all the best in the Active Nation Scottish Cup Final on 15 May 2010 back at Hampden Park. Supported by: John Wilson*, Bill Kidd*, Rob Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*, Jamie Stone*, Angela Constance*, Brian Adam*, Ian McKee*
S3M-6124 Celtic 0 - 2 Ross County, Bucked by the Staggies (lodged on 12 April 2010) Robin Harper*, Liam McArthur*
S3M-6124 Celtic 0 - 2 Ross County, Bucked by the Staggies (lodged on 12 April 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Peter Peacock*, Willie Coffey*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-6124 Celtic 0 - 2 Ross County, Bucked by the Staggies (lodged on 12 April 2010) Maureen Watt*

S3M-6124 Dave Thompson: Celtic 0 - 2 Ross County, Bucked by the Staggies—That the Parliament congratulates Ross County Football Club on its historic 2-0 Scottish Cup semi-final win over Celtic; welcomes the goodwill felt throughout the Highlands from this momentous win, with more County fans travelling from the Highlands to watch the match at Hampden Park than the entire population of Dingwall; notes that this win puts County on the map as a serious competitor, and wishes these Highland heroes all the best in the Active Nation Scottish Cup Final on 15 May 2010 back at Hampden Park. Supported by: John Wilson, Bill Kidd, Rob Gibson, Aileen Campbell, Jamie Stone, Angela Constance, Brian Adam, Ian McKee, Robin Harper, Liam McArthur, Jamie Hepburn, Peter Peacock, Willie Coffey, Gil Paterson, Maureen Watt
